summary: This is a November 9, 2021 letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to defense counsel in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, transmitting a production of discovery materials. The letter explains the materials are business records from Southern District of Florida files, largely duplicative of prior productions, and are governed by a protective order.

events.title: Discovery Production to Maxwell Defense
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the SDNY produces a set of discovery materials (business records from SDFL files) to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense counsel.

events.title: Protective Order Issued
events.description: A protective order was issued in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, governing the handling of confidential discovery materials.

events.title: Prior Discovery Production from Florida FBI File
events.description: In the fall of 2020, the Government previously produced materials from the Florida FBI file to Maxwell's defense team.

keyFacts: The document is a formal discovery production letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team, dated November 9, 2021.

The materials produced are described as 'Business Records from SDFL [Southern District of Florida] Files' and are largely duplicative of materials previously produced from the Florida FBI file in fall 2020.
The production is governed by a protective order dated July 31, 2020, and the materials are marked with a specific label referencing paragraphs of that order.
The letter notes the Department of Justice directed the office to cease using the word 'confidential' on such materials to avoid confusion with classified document markings.
The document references the ongoing criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330 (MN).
